result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar Trevino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Electronic monitoring allowed on one half of the remaining sentence he has if he qualifies after a new assessment.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the DNA and drug abuse surcharges.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to controlled substances. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

Use only 1 pharmacy to obtain controlled substances. 
Sign any releases agent needs to monitor. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide a DNA sample. 
Court will allow early discharge if he has met all conditions and the agent recommends.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 90 days jail. 
May serve that on Electronic Monitoring, concurrent with 14CT277, if he qualifies for that program.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CT277.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Oscar Trevino in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:41 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
All files heard: 15CF110, 15CF179, 14CT277, 15CM106

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF110 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
14CT277 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF110 Count 1, 14CT277.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed & read-in: 15CF110 Counts 2 & 3, 15CF179 & 15CM106 in their entirety. 
 
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CT277 -
Serve 30 days jail. 
Allowed to serve the entire period on Home Monitor if he qualifies. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report within 24 hours for start date.
Pay fine of $250 plus costs.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan and comply with the plan. 

15CF110 Count 1 - 
Serve 9 months jail - STAYED -
Electronic monitoring allowed on one half of the remaining sentence he has if he qualifies after a new assessment. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years:
Serve 90 days jail. 
May serve that on Electronic Monitoring, concurrent with 14CT277, if he qualifies for that program.  
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to controlled substances. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use only 1 pharmacy to obtain controlled substances. 
Sign any releases agent needs to monitor. 
Maintain fulltime employment
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay costs including the DNA and drug abuse surcharges. 
Court will allow early discharge if he has met all conditions and the agent recommends.

ADDRESS INFO for Oscar Trevino
Current: 2816 Rice St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 05-26-2015)
Prior: 2816 Rice Street, Stevens Point, WI

3:27 p.m. Defendant Oscar Trevino in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case 15CF179 being heard for Initial Appearance, Waiver of Preliminary and Arraignment today.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Preliminary Hearing for 15CF179 and 15CF110:
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment for 15CF179 and 15CF110:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for Attorney to Appear and Act

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.

Defendant Oscar Trevino in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant states he would like to plead guilty to everything. 
Court adjourns for 2 weeks to allow for defendant to consult with the public defender. 

State recommends a $5,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
